creator: carsten.prinz@me.com
text:
Created attachment 24693
patch for file_io/win32/dir.c

According to the documentation,
apr_dir_read(...) returns APR_ENOENT in case no more entries are available.
On WIN32 (and WIN64 of course), the method returns platform specific return code apr_get_os_error() instead.

The Attachment contains a patch for file_io/win32/dir.c fixing the problem.
